comment: Greasy finish on the end, like cooked duck.
Calm vanilla, moderate oak, definite leather. Not sure it's toffee on the finish but I like it.

Tried this one early on in my bourbon tastings. Recall it being pretty good but can't recall why.
8/14/14 - tried it again - and liked it a lot more.  Smooth, caramel, vanilla.  Very nice.
Good and even better on ice with a little water.
Had a couple pours tonight and this surprisingly good.
Not too sweet, but still tasty and spicy.

Funky banana, dried fruit, cinnamon, nutmeg and toffee on the nose. The palate is sophisticated with charred wood, leather and earthy notes. With a little water it develops into smokey spice and burnt orange peel which lingers long and hard on the finish. The finish resolves with calmer caramel and toffee notes, giving you a queue for your next sip. It's a quality bottle, but a little too leather-centric for my tastes.

Sweet cherries, vanilla, pipe tobacco, milk chocolate and hint of dill on the nose. The mouthful is warm, robust and spicy, with roasted almonds, molasses and hints of melon and licorice on the palate. The finish sweet, oaky and fairly long. A complex and delicious rye that is definitely worth a try.
Geekfest 13. Paired with Willett, which was better. Very average rye.

Good with little water very smooth aged the bitterness out of it
71$

Man that is some good stuff, and reminds me that Jim Murray picked the wrong Canadian rye as Canada's best offering. The rye note is warm and welcoming, never overpowering, with dill and vanilla added for good measure. There are also some subtle banana and molasses aromas if you search long enough, adding complexity to this fine whisky. The finish is smooth as a baby, calling your mouth back for another round. Recommended!
Leather, vanilla, wood. Nice rolling warmth.

There's just something about Masterson's Rye. I don't know if it's a sense of nostalgia, it being one of the gateway whiskeys that got me into whiskey in the first place, or whether it is a genuinely solid product that compels me back for more. It's distinctly rye with sweet with solid spice. It has more body than other ryes I've sampled and this sense of "I know exactly what I am." That confidence is loud and undeniable. This is one of my personal favorites. (FWF share #1)
For my money the best Canadian Rye money can by. It has all the freshness and spice of a big Alberta rye field.

I’m leaving this here as there is not a product profile for the Hungarian Oak offering. This variation produces a unique smokiness and oak flavor the other Masterson products lack. Overall, a solid sipper, but would not pay MSRP for this bottle.

Easy drinking
A touch of sweet
No heat or smoke of note

Unfortunately it comes across as typically Canadian. It’s smooth and sweet with gentle rye grain and spice. It’s just a little dry, and very slightly bitter. As a Canadian whisky it’s got a great profile but as a rye it falls into the realm of boring and underwhelming. Either way it’s not worth the price. $105 in Ontario.

My wife managed to pick up a bottle of batch PSA3, aged in American oak. Easily one of the best whisky's I have tasted. Certainly this year. A complex, spicy, balanced Rye. It bursts with flavour and I still remember the first sip and the involuntary "woah" . If you can find this batch from this year, it is a must try.
Neat - smooth with a mild aftertaste
This is really good. I’ve been curious for a long time and I’ll probably pull the trigger on a bottle now.
Amazing. Great peppery taste and smooth finish.
one of my absolute favorite ryes. not too sweet, just spicy enough & the rye taste is authentic like rye bread.
Traditional rye spice on the nose, with a peppery taste
Spicy with a lot of heat, medium finish
Smooth, sweet with touch of vanilla. Nice
Neat in rocks glass at Yard House DC. Nose: definite apples, lite baking spices, mild oak.  Taste: creamy spices, bittersweet, oak and apple peel. Lingering spicy finish.  Ok.  12/5/19.
Smells of rye bread with pepper slight cinnamon, tastes of caramel ginger little to much burn
Kind of flat. Not a lot of flavor for a 10 year old rye. Probably will not buy again.

Ok right off the bat ignore the " professional " review... most here are pretentious as hell..

Just tried this, really wasn't expecting much tbh... nevertheless I opened the bottle let is sit for about 3 min then took a good sniff...wow!  The toffee up front was so enticing....I poured a nice pour let it sit for 5 min as iij do with all spirits..  took my first sip and man a really nice spice hit me in the mouth again with the toffee...the linger was nice changing tastes as I sat there from sweet to a leathery spice...and nice moderate finish and great after taste.. buy this .  70 bucks is a tad high I think this is a 50 dollar bottle..but if buy again no doubt
A terrific Rye. It has one outstanding flavor I can’t quite put my finger on but it’s finish is as dynamic as the best Ryes out there. Will buy again.
Very smooth and made for a gentleman!

A good no nonsense rye that won’t push anyone away. Nose is just what a rye smells like, light honey, rye spice, eucalyptus, no anise. Palate enters very gentle and light, not a heavy oily whiskey, not very sweet either. Development bitter citrus rind that gives way to rye spice and leather. Finish is all leather and dry. Might make a good cocktail.

Few whiskies have wide a disparity between the nose and palate. It has a tea-like herbal smell, with evergreen. But the flavor is candied pecans, vanilla, butterscotch like a classic bourbon and smooth as butter. One that starts to win me over to rye. 3.5
spicy, vanilla, well rounded. full-bodied. not very hot.

Batch 015. Very disappointing for price. No sweetness, mild spice, what little flavor there is is overwhelmed by ethanol burn. I’ve read batches fluctuate drastically in taste and this batch is known to be one of their weakest, but I’d be very unlikely to give this another chance.
Smoothest whiskey I’ve ever tried. Almost doesn’t feel like alcohol
Very woody with bit of spice. Nice sipping whiskey
Enjoyable for sure. I’m not into rye but this was good
Solid spice with abundant vanilla sweetness. Almost has wheated sweetness.
Very sweet. Clean, crisp. Vanilla. Toffee
Pretty week knee'd. Sweet and simple. Think Canadian Club Rye type of thing.
Super light rye spice on the nose. Mostly alcohol though. Has that kinda soapy rye flavor for me, not a fan. Might be some sort of light herb.
